from datetime import timedelta, datetime
from dateutil.relativedelta import relativedelta
import calendar
import json
from notebookutils import mssparkutils
from azure.storage.blob import BlobServiceClient
import pyspark.sql.functions as F
import pyspark.sql.window as W
from pyspark.sql import Row

blob_service_client = BlobServiceClient.from_connection_string(hubAutomationConnectionString)

# get a reference to the blob container and file
container_name = 'sql-config'
blob_name = 'config.json'
container_client = blob_service_client.get_container_client(container_name)
blob_client = container_client.get_blob_client(blob_name)

# download the blob content as a string
blob_content = blob_client.download_blob().content_as_text()

# parse the JSON string into a Python dictionary
sql_config = json.loads(blob_content)

sql_metersubcategory_array = sql_config['MeterSubCategory']
sql_days_back_from = sql_config['daysBackFrom']
sql_days_back_to = sql_config['daysBackTo']
sql_enterprise_licence_cores = sql_config['enterprise_licence_cores']
sql_standard_licence_cores = sql_config['enterprise_licence_cores']

sql_normalized_licence_cores = (4 * sql_enterprise_licence_cores) + sql_standard_licence_cores

sql_start_date = (datetime.now() - timedelta(days=sql_days_back_from+6)).strftime('%Y-%m-%d')
sql_end_date = (datetime.now() - timedelta(days=sql_days_back_to+6)).strftime('%Y-%m-%d')
sql_cost_df = cost_df.where((F.col('Date') >= sql_start_date) & (F.col('Date') <= sql_end_date))

sql_max_date = sql_cost_df.agg(F.max('Date')).collect()[0][0]
sql_min_date = sql_cost_df.agg(F.min('Date')).collect()[0][0]
sql_interval_days = (sql_max_date - sql_min_date).days + 1
sql_interval_hours = sql_interval_days * 24

sql_cost_df = sql_cost_df.select(*sql_columns)
sql_cost_df = sql_cost_df.where(F.col('MeterSubCategory').isin(sql_metersubcategory_array))
sql_cost_df = sql_cost_df.where(~F.upper(F.col('ResourceName')).startswith('CVD-'))

is_sql_vm = (F.col('MeterCategory') == 'Virtual Machines Licenses') & (F.col('MeterSubCategory').like('SQL Server%'))
is_sql_db = (F.col('ResourceId').like('%Microsoft.Sql/servers%')) & (F.col('MeterCategory').like('SQL%'))
is_sql_mi = (F.col('ResourceId').like('%Microsoft.Sql/managedInstances%')) & (F.col('MeterCategory').like('SQL%'))

sql_cost_df = sql_cost_df.withColumn('SQLType', 
    F.when(is_sql_vm, 'VM')
    .when(is_sql_mi, 'MI')
    .when(is_sql_db, 'DB')
    .otherwise(None)
)

sql_cost_df = sql_cost_df.withColumn('Priority',
    F.when(is_sql_mi & (F.col('ProductName').contains('General Purpose')), 6)
    .when(is_sql_mi & (F.col('ProductName').contains('Business Critical')), 5)
    .when(is_sql_db & (F.col('ProductName').contains('General Purpose')), 4)
    .when(is_sql_vm & (F.col('ProductName').startswith('SQL Server Enterprise') | (F.col('ProductName') == 'SQL Server Azure Hybrid Benefit - Enterprise Edition License')), 3)
    .when(is_sql_db & (F.col('ProductName').contains('Business Critical')), 2)
    .when(is_sql_vm & (F.col('ProductName').startswith('SQL Server Standard') | (F.col('ProductName') == 'SQL Server Azure Hybrid Benefit - Standard Edition License')), 1)
    .otherwise(0)
)

sql_cost_df = sql_cost_df.where(F.col('SQLType').isNotNull())
sql_cost_copy = sql_cost_df.alias('sql_cost_copy')

sql_cost_df = sql_cost_df \
    .select('ResourceId', 'SubscriptionId', 'ResourceGroup', 'ResourceName', 'Quantity', 'ai_VCPUs', 'ai_vCores', 'SQLAHB_VCPUs', 'SQLType', 'Priority') \
    .groupBy('ResourceId', 'SubscriptionId', 'ResourceGroup', 'ResourceName', 'ai_VCPUs', 'ai_vCores', 'SQLAHB_VCPUs', 'SQLType', 'Priority') \
    .agg(F.sum('Quantity').alias('ResourceHours'))

# SQL VM instances will have a quantity per resource per day at 0-24 hours
vm_utilization = F.col('ResourceHours') / sql_interval_hours

# SQL MI and DB instances will have a quantity per resource per day at 0-24 hours * vCores
resource_hours_per_core = F.col('ResourceHours') / F.col('ai_vCores')

mi_utilization = resource_hours_per_core / sql_interval_hours
db_utilization = resource_hours_per_core / sql_interval_hours

sql_cost_df = sql_cost_df.withColumn('Utilization',
    F.when(F.col('SQLType') == 'VM', vm_utilization)
    .when(F.col('SQLType') == 'DB', db_utilization)
    .when(F.col('SQLType') == 'MI', mi_utilization)
    .otherwise(0)
)

sql_cost_df = sql_cost_df.orderBy(F.desc('Priority'), F.desc('Utilization'))

window = W.Window.rowsBetween(W.Window.unboundedPreceding, 0)
sql_cost_df = sql_cost_df.withColumn("TotalNormalizedCores", F.sum("SQLAHB_VCPUs").over(window))

sql_enable_df = sql_cost_df.where(F.col('TotalNormalizedCores') <= sql_normalized_licence_cores)

# Compute the number of cores ACTUALLY assigned
sql_assigned_cores = sql_enable_df.agg(F.max('TotalNormalizedCores')).collect()[0][0]

# Aggregate enabled resources for activity log entry
log_df = sql_enable_df.select('SQLAHB_VCPUs', 'Priority').groupBy('Priority').agg(F.sum('SQLAHB_VCPUs').alias('TotalCores'))

sql_enable_df = sql_enable_df.select('ResourceId', 'SubscriptionId', 'ResourceName', 'ResourceGroup')

sql_disable_df = sql_cost_copy.where(F.col('SQLAHB') == 'Enabled')
sql_disable_df = sql_disable_df.select('ResourceId', 'SubscriptionId', 'ResourceName', 'ResourceGroup')
sql_disable_df = sql_disable_df.dropDuplicates(["ResourceId"])
sql_disable_df = sql_disable_df.join(sql_enable_df, 'ResourceId', 'left_anti')

# Construct new activity log entry and write back to file

log_entry = log_df.collect()
activity_values = [0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0]
index = 0
for value in log_entry:
    activity_values[index] = value['TotalCores']
    index+=1

new_activity_row = spark.createDataFrame([(today, *activity_values, sql_normalized_licence_cores, sql_assigned_cores)], activity_df.columns)
activity_df = activity_df.union(new_activity_row)
